Snippet 1 provides the basic information that the reduced speed leads to heavier rainfall and a higher risk of flooding. Snippet 3 states that a slower moving cyclone has the potential to dump up to 20 percent more rain. Snippet 4 confirms that this trend is increasing local rainfall totals and freshwater flooding, which is associated with high mortality risk. Snippet 1 provides the initial cause of the CO2 crisis: the unusually high number of closures of ammonia plants producing CO2 as a by-product. Snippet 4 explains that multiple plants have closed due to technical issues and planned repairs, exacerbating the crisis. Snippet 2 provides context as to why this happens - ammonia plants often close for maintenance over the summer when fertiliser demand is low, but this year several have closed at once, leading to the crisis. Snippet 3 explains that the UK is the worst-hit country, with only one operational CO2 plant, making it difficult for the country to import CO2, and this specific crisis has affected the production of crumpets at Warburton's factories.
